fa683059-b9de-4063-ae71-597ed4e2df30.text: Attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.

fa798a3d-7797-4795-b251-a45f0429d169.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles their library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

fb1369aa-25a2-4e2a-9cbe-6cfe7e238b1b.text: Creatures can't be the targets of spells.

fb81f95c-70f8-4eb7-8d15-15d0ae23ec03.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

fbb0f73b-5e30-4632-99c1-e49582e41f8d.text: Exile a card from your hand: Add {B}{B} or {G}{G}.

fbd99a88-8926-455e-8e23-58fed6d14719.text: You gain life equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

fc0907eb-a3fc-40ef-950d-b05aee9d5da7.text:

fc638800-6aec-4a48-ad2c-c9a5ce93c236.text:
Flying
{1}{B}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card unless they put a card from their hand on top of their library. If that player discards a card this way, Tainted Specter deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

fce29dd8-23b1-465c-a977-526f716dc8f6.name: Dragon Mask
fce29dd8-23b1-465c-a977-526f716dc8f6.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

Sacrifice Iron-Heart Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains vigilance. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

ffa93a79-7a10-4331-91de-eabbc4fee17e.name: Barishi
ffa93a79-7a10-4331-91de-eabbc4fee17e.text: When Barishi dies, exile Barishi, then shuffle all creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.flavor: Facets of life, reflections of the soul.
"One timely cry of warning can save nine of surprise." —Sidar Jabari
The best use for a unicorn's horn is to adorn a unicorn. —Femeref adage
"My shield will bear a shining sun so you will always be with me. / Inlaid with gold, it will shine like glowing embers." —"Love Song of Night and Day"
To condemn the innocent you must first condemn yourself. —Civic Guild maxim
"Mangara is gone. Who among you doubts that I have taken his power?" —Kaervek
"There are harsher ways to learn the meaning of the word 'no.'" —Rashida Scalebane
"Suq'Ata believe in trade; Femeref, alms; Zhalfirins, steel. Be warned, Kaervek—now we are joined." —Sidar Jabari
"To the undiscerning eye, justice and vengeance can look the same." —Rashida Scalebane
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
"I do not teach. I simply reveal." —Daudi, Femeref tutor
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles." —Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba
"Faith is my shield, and hope is my armor; I am vulnerable only to myself." —Asmira, Holy Avenger
"I will return / with lizard skins for your sandals. Paint your eyes black and wait for me." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

"The days before the war were filled with strange portents: scouts and herders spoke of villages reduced to ash, of farmers taken from their fields, and of foul beasts roaming the plains in packs. I know, for I spoke to them all." —Hakim, Loreweaver
"The Femeref look only to the Sun for healing; they have never truly understood life's cycle." —Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage
"A brilliant light can either illuminate or blind. How will you know which until you open your eyes?" —Asmira, Holy Avenger
"The fury in the lion's eye; the patience in the hippo's yawn; the pride within the griffin's cry are one within the iron tusk's stride." —"Iron Tusk," Femeref song
"Common soldiers can't understand what a sidar knows: the enemy can be a resource." —Sidar Jabari
Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.
"Unlike Zhalfir, the griffin needs no council to keep harmony among its parts." —Asmira, Holy Avenger
"All animals—even humans—can be herded. The trick is to make them think they choose their own destination." —Mangara
"Proud am I, / strong am I, / courageous in defending my children / and fierce in punishing what stands in my way." —"So the Elephant Speaks," Zhalfirin song
Discovered by Femeref mages, the Null Chamber is the ultimate testing ground for the uncreative.
For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
"They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings." —Hakim, Loreweaver
It is not by the blood of dragons that Rashida measures victories, but by the sum of children who no longer wake from nightmares of scales and fire.
"Our soldiers are blessed with lizard scales as hard and cold as steel." —Sidar Jabari
"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves." —"Song to the Sun," Femeref song
Light creates shadow; light destroys shadow. Such is the transience of darkness.
"Prophecy is whatever one makes of it, but destiny cannot be changed." —Sidar Jabari
"A treasure to guard other treasures is worth the highest price." —Mtai, Civic Guildmage
"There is no sweeter music than the wails of a dying dragon." —Rashida Scalebane
"When we're aloft, I love to lean over the Weatherlight's railing and watch the patterns the griffins' shadows make on the clouds below." —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
The griffin's shadow gives courage to the righteous and dread to the idle.
Telim'Tor could no longer recall the exact number of assaults—but his troops could.
"Command is the act of balancing on a vine and convincing others that it is firm ground." —Sidar Jabari
"You returned a warrior. . . . Your hair was cut, your eye tattooed with the red triangle of war." —"Love Song of Night and Day"
"If the griffins tell of their gods, perhaps they speak of feathers bright as the Sun." —Afari, Tales
"Even the ancient storytellers proclaimed Zhalfir to be dominant over all Jamuraa. Kaervek's invasion shocked us all." —Hakim, Loreweaver
"A vizier's dish, best served drenched in honey and almonds." —Suq'Ata royal recipe
"Wear the falcon's feathers in your hair— be fast as the falcon, bright as the Sun." —"Rise on Wings," Zhalfirin song
A lie always returns; be careful how you catch it.

"Once, a Quirion asked why I was so cautious when the day was clear. I told him of the sky-blue hide of the cerluean wyvern, and he offered me double if I could conjure a strong tailwind!" —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
"Useful . . . if you can find it." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.
"If you weren't born with it, you don't need it." —Grahilah, former trader of Amiqat
Dreams' riches are easily spent. —Suq'Ata adage
Not only the sleeping should fear dreams.
"Whoa—my tail will never fit through that hole!"
"Quick, Rhirhok—teach me to swim!" —Makht, goblin casualty
"One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face." —Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor
"There's nothing like a sudden shock to clarify one's thoughts." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
". . . pirates gambled with a djinn and lost the thing more dear than gold." —"Love Song of Night and Day"
"Shadimir was as surprised as he was relieved when the blow turned aside." —Afari, Tales
"The caliph was so intelligent he could not remember what he knew." —Azeworai, "Three Riddles"
"Turn your back for a second and they just vanish! As if they weren't shifty enough before." —Rhirhok, goblin archer
The sea leaves no room for tears. —Zhalfirin adage
Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.
"Across the plains, farmers who braved the mists began to vanish. Most blamed the goblins; none guessed the truth." —Hakim, Loreweaver
"To the tutors, a 'poem of sand' was of little account, a 'poem of ivory,' priceless." —Afari, Tales
"Politics is a game—move a stone here, move a stone there—except sometimes the stones bleed." —Shauku, Endbringer
"Ahh! Opposable digits!"
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning." —Kaervek
"Heel."
"Can you prepare for the unexpected? No, you cannot. You can prepare only to be surprised." —Teferi
"We've run aground sandbars before, but today, a sandbar ran aground us." —Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate
Shape this world in Zhalfir's image. —Shaper Guild maxim
To buy unseen land, pay in unseen coin. —Suq'Ata maxim
"Would you give up your hands to fly? That is what the birds have done." —The One Thousand Questions
"Comfortable even in a furnace? I've never met one who'd accept my wager." —Talibah, embermage
"Taniwha rolls in its sleep, and the land is awash with the waves." —Poetics of Hanan
"Stepping through time is like riding a camel. It may get you where you want to go, but the ride is rarely pleasant." —Teferi
"We threw dried fruit to the drakes that rode the air, streaming along the Weatherlight's side as we sailed amidst the clouds." —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
Made you look.
The first of the Thousand Deaths.
When mountains ride the sea, waves live upon the fields.
"What is taking them so long to fill the waterskins?" —Mwani, Mtenda goatherd
"Consider the wave: how weak the mother yet how strong the child." —Tywanna, Shaper Guildmage
Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.
"What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest." —Kaervek
"The Mwonvuli Jungle has given the darkness teeth for tearing the gift of life from the weak." —Jolrael
A crash of rhinos in my head —Femeref expression meaning "a severe head pain"
"Only fools believe they will face my armies but once." —Kaervek
"As a child, I slept with a cloth over my face, to hide from the spirits that might pull the air from my lungs." —Mosi, Femeref weaver
Grieve for the soul in death dishonored. —Shadow Guild saying
King or herder, the maggots care not.
"The people wiped the sand from their eyes and cursed—and left the barren land to the hyenas and vipers." —Afari, Tales
"Femeref was guided by the wisdom of the Council of Voices. But in one terrible instant, they were slain, leaving Asmira as the sole voice of leadership." —Hakim, Loreweaver
"The ceremony ended with a voice from the shadows, a voice with vast, ominous power." —Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage
"The foul entities of the Uuserk swamp had never before dared to spread their influence to the very heart of Zhalfir." —Hakim, Loreweaver
Whatever follows life is incurable. —Zhalfirin aphorism
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it." —Kaervek
"The night stalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref." —Kaervek

"Of the six who went down the Uuserek Trail to scout ahead, one returned. She clawed at her eyes and nostrils and sobbed with horror. I was curious about what she saw, but we chose another path." —Scout Ekemet, final journal
"I no longer believe in a final resting place." —Shauku, Endbringer
"A zombie's bed must be a lumpy one or he wouldn't leave it so often." —Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
Embrace the Harbinger —Suq'Ata expression meaning "abandon hope"
"But I signed nothing!" —Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage
"If the curse does not strike you dead, question your soul." —Kaervek
"We realized the bog had not given up a soul but had come to claim a new one." —Scout Ekemet, final journal
"The finest offering of night is not stealth but daring." —Tetlok, Breathstealer
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory." —Jolrael
"In your final breath you still have something to offer Phyrexia." —Afari, Tales
Eternal life brings eternal hunger.
"I don't know what takes them; they die around me without time to scream." —Scout Ekemet, final journal
The rich's heirs often thank them after death . . . but preferably not in person. —Suq'Ata epigram
You lie down with rats, and the rats run away. —Suq'Ata insult
To keep the dead so others may live. —Shadow Guild maxim
Good help is hard to dig up.
"They exist only so long as the living take no notice." —Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage
"Since I cannot stop death, I choose to stop life." —Kaervek
"The flesh is a casket for the soul." —Shauku, Endbringer
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness. —Suq'Ata saying
"I shall make walls of their flesh, and their blood will be my mortar." —Kaervek
